moves.1. e4: I play black on this one, and the ending is a beauty!  Respectable I do believe!
moves.1... d6 2. Nf3 e5 3. Bc4: he's coming after me with the classic knight/bishop combo, lets see how I fair
moves.3... Be6 4. Bxe6: take here to disrupt my kings bishop pawn, and cause 2 pawns on the same file...this bothers me
moves.5... Nf6 6. d3 c6: I do this to open the queen, and if he moves his knight it's a nice little pitfall for me with q-a5
moves.7. Bg5: blocking my knight, but the pitfall is slowly coming
moves.7... d5 8. Nxe5: this move was a blunder on his part, falling prey to a trap in 3 moves, losing his knight
moves.8... d4: pawn up to remove his knight and creating an open horizontal
moves.10. c3 Qxe5: good job by me, now his bishop is in peril
moves.11. Bf4 Qc5 12. Nxd4 e5 13. Nb3 Qe7: now he can safely move his bishop
moves.14. Bg5 Nbd7 15. O-O h6 16. Bh4 O-O-O: I'm not a huge fan of the queen side castle, but my pawn situation isn't wonderful on the king side, plus i get my Rook on the same file as his queen
moves.17... g5 18. Bg3 Qf7 19. f3 Nc5 20. Nxc5: It's here that I see my opportunity for the checkmate on h1, I just wasn't sure how exactly what to do with the pawn I knew was coming on p-d4
moves.21. Kh1 Nh5 22. Bxe5: now a new problem with the bishop
moves.22... Rhf8 23. d4: theres the pawn-d4, but this is forcing him to move his queen
moves.23... Rfe8: I plan on taking the bishop
moves.24. Qe2: so he moves his queen, but in doing so falls for the trap
moves.25. dxe5: of course you take the Rook!  lol
moves.25... Ng3+: he's forced to take the knight
